decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on using disruption and card advantage to stay ahead of the opponent. It includes powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also features efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Wasteland to deal with threats. With the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den providing additional value, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Doomsday, set up the perfect pile, and win the game by using Thassa's Oracle to draw a card and win the game if you have no cards in your library. The deck includes various powerful spells and mana acceleration to help achieve this goal efficiently and effectively, while also containing disruption elements to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through powerful draw spells like Dig Through Time and Ancestral Recall. The deck also includes efficient threats like Murktide Regent to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. By controlling the opponent's plays and resources, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately taking control of the game and emerging victorious.

The deck utilizes artifact ramp and fast mana to accelerate into powerful threats quickly, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient mana generation. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while pressuring them with strong artifact creatures and artifacts that can generate card advantage and additional resources. With a focus on speed and synergy between artifacts, the deck seeks to close out games quickly before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on using artifacts like Coveted Jewel and Mishra's Workshop to generate mana and draw cards with Paradoxical Outcome. It aims to assemble key pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring to create infinite turns or generate massive advantage. It also has backup win conditions like Urza's Saga and Tezzeret, the Cruel Captain. The deck utilizes powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Force of Will for card advantage and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful artifact synergy.

The main concept of this MUD aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Trinisphere, Sphere of Resistance, and Null Rod, while ramping up mana quickly using artifacts like Black Lotus and Ancient Tomb. The deck also aims to control the battlefield with creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem, and generate card advantage through cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge. Overall, the deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of disruptive elements and aggressive threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to slow down the opponent's game plan. By utilizing hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's spells while applying pressure with creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. The inclusion of cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Void Mirror further hinders the opponent's ability to cast spells efficiently. The deck also includes fast mana acceleration like Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy its threats and control elements like Karakas and Wasteland to deal with problematic opposing creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble an aggressive board presence through the efficient use of artifacts, primarily utilizing Mishra's Workshop to power out larger threats early in the game. By leveraging cards like Scrawling Crawler and Glaring Fleshraker that benefit from artifacts being in play, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and synergy. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provides additional versatility and control options to deal with different types of threats.

The deck is focused on assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly. Using a combination of tutors, card draw, and counterspells, the goal is to find and cast Doomsday, then stack the top of the library in a way that allows Thassa's Oracle to win the game when it enters the battlefield. The deck includes various ways to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's plays, making it a powerful and resilient strategy in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck revolves around using artifacts and spells to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, ultimately leading to a game-winning combo using Paradoxical Outcome to draw a massive amount of cards and generate a significant amount of mana. The deck includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxes, as well as disruptive spells like Force of Will to protect the combo. The inclusion of Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and win conditions. The deck aims to control the game early on and then quickly assemble the combo for a decisive victory.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with artifacts and disrupt their strategy using cards like Null Rod and Sphere of Resistance. The deck aims to utilize Mishra's Workshop to quickly deploy powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem while also using cards like Mystic Forge and Ancient Tomb for additional card advantage and mana acceleration. With a focus on locking down the opponent's resources and overwhelming them with efficient threats, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

This deck focuses on using powerful control elements and the Gifts Ungiven package to outvalue opponents and disrupt their game plan. By effectively managing resources and leveraging graveyard interactions, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and eventually overwhelm the opponent with efficient spells and powerful threats. Cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Underworld Breach are key components of the deck's strategy, allowing it to both protect its game plan and execute powerful combos. Ultimately, the goal is to outmaneuver opponents and control the pace of the game until victory is secure.

The focus of the deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, along with mana acceleration from Black Lotus and various Moxen, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver its opponent. Gifts Ungiven allows for versatile search options, while the inclusion of Lurrus as a companion provides additional recursion and flexibility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game, disrupting the opponent's plans, and ultimately securing victory through resource advantage.

This deck focuses on leveraging Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards and generate mana, allowing for explosive plays and combos. With a mix of powerful artifacts, countermagic, and card draw spells, the deck aims to assemble key pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its synergistic interactions. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing for recursion of key cards from the graveyard. The deck's focus on efficient card draw and mana generation sets it up for explosive turns and the ability to win the game in a single, decisive move.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Mindbreak Trap to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor allows for finding key combo pieces or answers when needed. Gifts Ungiven is used to search for specific cards while stocking up the graveyard for later use with cards like Brain Freeze and Underworld Breach. The deck aims to out-value the opponent through efficient interaction and powerful card advantage engines like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Tolarian Academy.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with hate cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror. By using disruptive elements like Void Mirror and Thalia, Heretic Cathar, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells and prevent them from executing their strategy effectively. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana acceleration through cards like Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy its threats and outpace the opponent. The goal is to control the game tempo and close out the match swiftly.
